issue.title: [Python] Create external repo with appveyor.yml configured for building Python wheel installers
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-1068](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-1068). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
The goal will be able to create Windows wheel binaries for a given release of Arrow

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-1068?focusedCommentId=16036346) by Max Risuhin (Max Risuhin):*
External repo URL: https://github.com/MaxRis/pyarrow-wheel-cibuild
ZIPped version of repo sources will be attached.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-1068?focusedCommentId=16036347) by Max Risuhin (Max Risuhin):*
ZIPped version of repo with building of Python wheel and uploading to AWS S3 bucket. Configuration instructions are in README.md

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-1068?focusedCommentId=16048058) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
This is done, I'm hosting the repo at https://github.com/wesm/pyarrow-windows-wheels. We should consider combining all the wheel builds (including manylinux1 into a single repo)
